title: BSC Archival falling behind regularly
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `./erigon --version`
Started for me at 2.32, and have upgraded and still regularly encountered, now stuck and not moving forward for a day with 2.39
OS & Version: Windows/Linux/OSX
Debian 11
Commit hash: 

Erigon Command (with flags/config):
`erigon --config=/erigon/config/config.toml --torrent.upload.rate=\"512mb\" --torrent.download.rate=\"512mb\" --db.pagesize=16k `
config:
```
datadir = "/erigon/data/erigon"
port = "55401"
chain = "bsc"
http = "true"

"http.addr" = "0.0.0.0"
"http.api" = "eth,bsc,erigon,web3,net,debug,trace,txpool,miner"
"http.port" = "55400"
"http.corsdomain" = "*"
"http.vhosts" = "*"
```

Chain/Network: 
bsc archival
#### Expected behaviour
Chain stays at tip, doesn't fall behind

#### Actual behaviour
Logs full of errors like the following below, falls behind tip and stays behind for hundreds or thousands of blocks at a time.


Backtrace

At other times it's stuck at stage 2, as in this issue
https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/issues/5703
@icculp Can you try to use the mdbx snapshot and then try reboot again? https://github.com/bnb-chain/bsc-snapshots

> @icculp Can you try to use the mdbx snapshot and then try reboot again? https://github.com/bnb-chain/bsc-snapshots

This snapshot seems to be a full node chaindata, not an archive node.

I spent weeks syncing from scratch, and it needs to remain an archival node, not pruned. For context, this is the only thing running on a server with 128gb ram, 32 threads, and 2x 4tb gen4 nvme in raid 0.

For extra context, this bsc archival is now serving the altruist backup for the pocket network. In the past a restart has gotten things moving forward again after a while, but the past 2 days it hasn't worked. I have tried unwinding 1, 10, and now 100 blocks and it looks to have finally moved past stage 5 (but not caught up yet).

Finished that cycle of stages to about 1k blocks behind, stuck at stage 2 again... 2k blocks behind now...

```

```

> > @icculp Can you try to use the mdbx snapshot and then try reboot again? https://github.com/bnb-chain/bsc-snapshots
> 
> This snapshot seems to be a full node chaindata, not an archive node.

It's the mdbx database file of archive node. The erigon will start as archive node by default, right?

`/dev/md2       7434686824 6389372468 670552168  91% /`
```
np@pokt-05-a:~$ du -sh bsc
5.9T    bsc
```
Archive is 2.2tb and decompressed it's 5.3tb. Doing in place extraction with wget would require me to shut the node down and delete my data, and then hope and pray that it all downloads and extracts properly in 1 go, and that it doesn't take days (since I can't use aria2 and extract locally). This after spending weeks to sync from scratch... The node did catch back up a couple hours after I posted last, and stayed in sync for about 5.5 hours, and then fell back behind again
Just tried adding `--p2p.protocol=66` flag, appears to be moving ahead again

I guess bsc doesn't support eth67, but both 66 and 67 were enabled by default
https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/issues/4563

Semantics of eth/67 is different in BSC than in ETH, and this would require careful exploration and fixing. However, we are not going to do that, because support for BSC will end (and code will be removed) after 1st of April: https://erigon.substack.com/p/future-of-the-support-of-bnb-smart
This issue is stale because it has been open for 40 days with no activity. Remove stale label or comment, or this will be closed in 7 days.
This issue was closed because it has been stalled for 7 days with no activity.
